intro: Melampyrum roseum subsp. ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaved touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are oval-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
